slts.slt: I can mint an Andamio Learner Token.
I can commit to an Assignment.
I can see an on-chain record of my completed Assignment.
I can write Lessons with Markdown.
I can explain what a Cardano transaction is and how much off-chain code can control.
I understand the the roles of different components in the context of a transaction.
I can tell when a transaction is valid from transaction context.
I understand the protocol limitation and and data format restriction in transaction building.
I can mint a native token, on both native script and plutus script.
I can build a valid transaction with more than one wallet signing against.
I can lock fund and unlock fund from a smart contract validator address
I can build a component to allow wallet stakes to a particular pool
I can write a component to verify message by signing against it

slts.title: Building Transactions with Mesh Lower Level APIs - MeshTxBuilder

slts.slt: I can send ADA to myself
I can send value to a script with inline datum attached
I can unlock fund from a validator
I can mint a smart contract native token
I can unlock fund from a script while minting a smart contract native token at the same time
I can build a transaction by providing an object of specification of transaction
I can set up App Wallet instance
I can perform automatic transaction building, signing and submission
I can return partially signed transaction to frontend for multi-sig
I can get parameterized scripts for transaction dynamically at transaction building.
I can navigate the source code repository for debugging.
I can describe precisely what error I am facing with Mesh with ways to reproduce.
I can add on the existing issue / create a new issue on Github for potential bugs.
I can fork Mesh's repository and create pull request for potential improvements or fixes.
